entry.title: Remarks on Craig Alan Feinstein’s papers and P versus NP.

link.title: Remarks on Craig Alan Feinstein’s papers and P versus NP.

entry.summary: Our attention has recently been drawn to Craig Alan Feinstein's work on P vs NP, and we record some ideas below. Basically we find that IF P is not equal to NP, then it will be unprovable because one cannot formally prove lower bounds on worst case complexity of algorithms. Or this is our impression at the moment.

entry.title: An Idea on Constructing Counterexamples to Larry Guth’s Sponge Problem using Jammed Packings.

link.title: An Idea on Constructing Counterexamples to Larry Guth’s Sponge Problem using Jammed Packings.

entry.summary: We record some ideas based on rigid disk packings to potentially construct open sets with arbitarily small volume and which cannot be expanded-embedded into the unit disk.

entry.title: Preprint on Closing Steinberg Symbols in Mapping Class Group with Applications to Constructing Spines.

link.title: Preprint on Closing Steinberg Symbols in Mapping Class Group with Applications to Constructing Spines.

entry.summary: Mapping Class Group, Bieri-Eckmann duality, spines, Teichmueller space

entry.title: Remarks on Ahlfor’s Measure Conjecture.
entry.summary: (Under construction) Here we record some observations and ideas regarding Ahlfor's measure conjecture. We begin writing basic python code to study limit points of divergent subsequences in Kleinian-type groups in higher dimensions. For the purposes of this article however we restrict ourselves to small dimensions.
